{{Infobox musical artist | name = Dougie Poynter | image = McFly-Poynter.jpg | caption = Poynter in 2007 | background = solo_singer | birth_name = Dougie Lee Poynter | Born = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1987|11|30}}
[[Corringham, Essex|Corringham]], [[Essex]], [[England]] | instrument = [[Bass guitar]], [[Singing|Vocals]], [[Guitar]] | genre = [[Pop rock]] | occupation = [[Musician]] | years_active = 2003âpresent | label = [[Island Records|Island]] (2003-07, 2010-present)
[[Super Records]] (2008-present) | associated_acts = [[McFly (band)|McFly]] | website = [http://www.mcfly.com/ McFly.com] | notable_instruments = [[Music Man Sterling]]
[[Music Man StingRay]]
[[Fender Jazz Bass]] }} '''Dougie Lee Poynter'''{{cite web|url=http://content.ancestry.co.uk/iexec/?htx=view&r=5538&dbid=8964&iid=ONS_B19681AZ-0308&fn=ln=Record+from+England+%26+Wales%2c+Birth+Index%3a+1837-1983&st=d&ssrc=&pid=695685|title=GRO Birth Registration Index|accessdate=2007-05-25|publisher=Ancestry.co.uk}} (born 30 November 1987 in [[Corringham, Essex|Corringham]], [[Essex]], [[England]]){{cn|date=November 2011}} is an [[English people|English]] [[musician]] and the [[bass guitar]]ist and [[singer|vocalist]] for the [[pop rock]] band [[McFly]]. == McFly == Poynter is [[bass guitar|bassist]] of pop band [[McFly]], also providing [[backing vocals|backing]], and on occasion, [[lead vocals]]. He has co-writer credits on many of McFly's tracks, including the lead writer credit on their 2007 number one single "[[Baby%27s_Coming_Back/Transylvania|Transylvania]]." Poynter has called "Transylvania" his favourite song that he has written.{{cite web|first=zarakenyon|title=McFly answer your questions in their hilarious interview|url=http://www.sugarscape.com/main-topics/lads/554638/mcfly-answer-your-questions-their-hilarious-interview|work=SugarScape|accessdate=17 October 2011}} The youngest member of the band, Poynter was also the last to enter it when [[Danny Jones]] and [[Tom Fletcher]], who already had been signed to a record deal with [[Island Records|Island]], held auditions for a bassist and drummer. Poynter was 15 when he was brought into the band. == Personal == Poynter was born in [[Orsett]], [[Essex]], England,{{cite web|url = http://www.mcflyofficial.com/theband/?id=4 |title = Dougie Poynter |publisher = [[McFly]] |accessdate = 25 May 2007 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070927092330/http://www.mcflyofficial.com/theband/?id=4 |archivedate = 27 September 2007}} and educated at [[Corringham Primary School]] before moving to [[Gable Hall School]], a state-owned Arts [[Foundation School]], in [[Corringham, Essex|Corringham]], Essex.{{cite web |url = http://www.simonswebsite.co.uk/mcfly/profiles/dougieprofile.php |title = McFly: Back to the Future - Dougie Poynter |accessdate = 20 March 2011}} Poynter is an avid sailor and currently races a Squib, looking to compete in the south west championships in 2012. Poynter dated [[Frankie Sandford]] of [[The Saturdays]],{{cite web |url = http://www.metro.co.uk/showbiz/interviews/461552-frankie-sandford-saves-her-pop-career-with-saturdays |title = Frankie Sandford saves her pop career with Saturdays |publisher = [[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]] |date = 6 January 2009 |accessdate = 20 July 2011}}{{cite web |url = http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/celebs-on-sunday/2009/05/03/5-minutes-with-a-sex-god-dougie-mcfly-115875-21316056/ |title = 5 minutes with aâ¦ sex god: Dougie McFly |publisher = [[Daily Mirror]] |date = 2 May 2009 |accessdate = 20 July 2011}}{{cite web |first = Benji |last = Wilson |url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/home/you/article-1246253/The-Saturdays-Pop-musics-new-high-flyers.html |title = The Saturdays: Pop music's new high-flyers |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2010-01-30 |accessdate=2011-07-20}}{{cite news | url = http://www.metro.co.uk/fame/article.html?McFlys_Dougie:_I_follow_Frankie&in_article_id=740346&in_page_id=7 | title = McFly's Dougie: I follow Frankie | publisher = Metro | date = 2009-09-18 | accessdate = 2009-09-24 }}{{cite news | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1235503/The-Saturdays-Frankie-Sandford-channels-Rihanna-suspender-tights-leather-hotpants-Christmas-party.html | title = The Saturdays' Frankie Sandford comes over all Lily Allen in suspender tights and leather hotpants for Christmas party | publisher = The Daily Mail| date = 2009-12-13 | accessdate = 2009-12-14 }} until the pair briefly split up in March 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/news/a207414/mcflys-dougie-confirms-split.html|title= McFly's Dougie confirms split|publisher=[[Digitalspy]]}} They reunited in April 2010,{{cite web|url=http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/celebrity-news/453158/frankie-sandford-dougie-and-i-are-living-together-again/1/|title=Frankie Sandford: Dougie and I are living together again|publisher=[[Now Magazine]]}} but split up again in November of the same year. Poynter has stated that they will not be getting back together for the third time.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1332012/Dougie-Poynter-Frankie-Sandford-split-second-time-year.html|title=Frankie Sandford dumps Dougie Poynter for the second time in a year, before partying at Whisky Mist with a male model|publisher=[[Daily Mail]]|date=2010-11-23|accessdate=2011-01-01}} He spent some time in [[Drug rehabilitation|rehab]] following the split.{{cite web|url=http://www.ok.co.uk/posts/view/33431/Poynter-Sandford-death-threats-are-out-of-control-/ |title=Poynter: 'Sandford death threats are out of control' |publisher=[[Ok! magazine]] |date=2011-03-21 |accessdate=2011-07-20}} In an interview with the [[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]] following his separation from Sandford, Poynter joked that he was "moving on to [dating] guys." and quipped that "none of [McFly] are homosexual. All of us are bisexual."{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/showbiz/music-news/2011/03/25/dougie-poynter-jokes-he-s-switching-to-dating-men-after-split-from-frankie-sandford-86908-23014951/ |title=Dougie Poynter jokes he's switching to dating men after split from Frankie Sandford |first=Bev |last=Lyons |publisher=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]] |date=2010-03-25 |accessdate=2011-11-14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a311174/dougie-poynter-ill-start-dating-men.html |title=Dougie Poynter: 'I'll start dating men' |first=Kristy |last=Kelly |publisher=[[Digital Spy]] |date=2010-03-25 |accessdate=2011-11-14}}{{cite web |url=http://akamai.nowmagazine.co.uk/celebrity-news/520275/dougie-poynter-quips-i-m-giving-up-girls-for-guys/1 |title=Dougie Poynter quips: I'm giving up girls for guys |first=Anna |last=Elliott |publisher=[[NOW (British magazine)|NOW]] |date=2010-03-25 |accessdate=2011-11-14}} ==Other work== Before joining McFly at the age of 15, Poynter was in a band named 'Ataiz'. In 2010, Dougie and three other people, including [[Motion In The Ocean]] and [[Radio:ACTIVE]] producer [[Jason Perry]], started a clothing line called 'Zukie' It was apparently named after Dougie's pet lizard. Dougie owns 30 per cent of the business. Also, in early 2011, it was confirmed that Dougie has started his own clothing range, by the name of 'Saint Kidd', a pirate-based company inspired by William Kidd. The range was set to launch in February. From November to December 2011, Dougie Poynter took part and won series 11 of I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here on ITV1, after being strongly persuaded by best friend and former winner Matt Willis, formerly of Busted. == Appearances == Poynter won the 2011 series of ''[[I'm a Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here! (UK series 11)|I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!]]''{{cite web|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/tv-and-radio/tvandradioblog/2011/nov/09/im-a-celebrity-2011-contestants|title=I'm a Celebrity 2011 contestants: retro stars meet the TOWIE generation|publisher=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=2011-11-09|date=2011-11-09}}. == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{commons category|McFly}} *{{Official website|http://dougiemcfly.com/}} *{{imdb name|1635150}} {{McFly}} {{I'm a Celebrity...Get Me out of Here!}} {{I'm a Celebrityâ¦Get Me out of Here!
